newsitem.title: USA: Kemp urges support for Iraq policy.
newsitem.headline: Kemp urges support for Iraq policy.

text.p: Republican vice presidential candidate Jack Kemp on Wednesday urged support for President Bill Clinton's attacks on Iraq.

"All of us, irrespective of political party, should share in support of the goals of this mission with our prayers, our hearts and our minds," Kemp told about 1,000 workers at a uniform manufacturing plant in the Cincinnati suburbs.
Kemp devoted most of his speech to the 15 percent income tax cut proposed by GOP presidential candidate Bob Dole.
"I almost said a 50 percent tax cut," he quipped at one point. "You ain't seen nothing yet."
He fielded questions from employees at the plant on issues ranging from welfare reform and corporate downsizing to assuring the integrity of pension funds.
Earlier in the day he participated in a $5,000 per couple fund-raising breakfast in Cincinnati. About 40 people showed up.
